description: Facts and certain transport-related documents about the London Borough of Croydon

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["We partner with Croydon to implement the Mayor's Transport Strategy in the borough."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP)"}
The LIP is produced by the London Borough of Croydon and agreed with us. It sets out the details on transport infrastructure changes in a three-year period to support the Mayor's Transport Strategy .

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) allocation 2019/20","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/croydon-2019-20-lip-allocation-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 218KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2017/18 - Borough Leader","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/1718-lip-confirmation-leader-letter-croydon.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 53KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2016/17","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lip-funding-confirmation-letters-16-17-croydon.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 69KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) delivery plan letter","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/croydon-lip-2014-15-delivery-plan-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 67KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Find out more about LIP funding.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"LIP targets for Croydon"}
Each borough has set targets in their LIP against the Mayor's Transport Strategy outcomes - we track and report on progress against these targets in the LIP3 MTS outcomes borough data pack .
For example, the car ownership in Croydon was 148,184 in 2017. The LIP target to reduce car ownership by 2021 is 141,200.
Residents in Croydon made an average of 843,000 trips each day between 2015 and 2018 by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Car and motorcycle: 48%","Tube/DLR: 1%","National Rail and London Overground: 10%","Bus/Tram: 15%","Taxi/Other: 1%","Cycle: 1%","Walking: 24%"]}
We also work with boroughs to encourage more cycling . We recorded 4,114 daily cycle trips on average starting in Croydon between 2015 and 2018.
More resident and visitor population figures are on the GLA website.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Funding for your borough"}
We provide funding to boroughs and local communities for transport improvements in your local area.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Vision Zero"}

We are working with boroughs to reduce the number of deaths and serious injuries from all road collisions to zero by 2041. They are responsible for enforcing safe speeds on their roads, as well as leading community programmes to encourage using roads safely. Find out more about Vision Zero .
In 2017 there were 126 individuals killed or seriously injured in Croydon. Our target for 2022 is to reduce this number to 88.
Find out more about collisions in your borough.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What we're working on in Croydon"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["We consult local communities on a range of projects every year - \u003ca href=\"https://consultations.tfl.gov.uk/consultation_finder/?advanced=1\u0026st=open\"\u003esearch on the TfL Consultation Hub\u003c/a\u003e ","Find out about \u003ca href=\"/status-updates/major-works-and-events\"\u003emajor works and events near you\u003c/a\u003e ","See some ongoing TfL \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/travel-information/improvements-and-projects/?Borough=Croydon\"\u003eimprovements and projects in or near Croydon\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Work now going on in your borough includes:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eFiveways\u003c/strong\u003e - we're working with the council to improve the \u003ca href=\"/travel-information/improvements-and-projects/a23-and-a232-fiveways-croydon\"\u003eA23 and A232 at Fiveways\u003c/a\u003e in Waddon for people walking and cycling","\u003cstrong\u003eTram improvements\u003c/strong\u003e - we're working with the council to create more space at key tram stops in Croydon town centre. This is on top of our ongoing maintenance and planned renewal work across the tram network","\u003cstrong\u003eGodstone Road traffic management \u003c/strong\u003e - changes to red route controls, zebra crossings and the road layout along a 3.3km stretch of A22 Godstone Road between Foxley Hill Road to Old Barn Lane will help improve parking, visibility from side roads and pedestrian safety","\u003cstrong\u003eHealthy High Streets\u003c/strong\u003e - Thornton Heath improvements include planting new trees, cleaning and repainting our assets, and decluttering pavements"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Bus network changes"}
From time to time - after consulting the public - we alter bus routes to reflect changing patterns in demand. We also make temporary changes, often because of road works. See the latest bus changes.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Our assets in Croydon"}
Assets we maintain in your borough include:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Two London Overground stations","24 tram stops","Around 990 bus stops - \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps_/bus-spider-maps?Query=Croydon\"\u003esee all 53 day bus routes in Croydon\u003c/a\u003e ","Two bus stations","Around 230 traffic signals","Over 27 kilometres of \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/modes/driving/red-routes/red-route-maps\"\u003ered routes\u003c/a\u003e "]}
See a map of our assets in London.
We maintain our assets until they need to be renewed or disposed of as set out in our asset management plan. We do this by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Servicing them regularly to keep them operational","Repairing or replacing faulty assets"]}
Report a problem on a London street with our Streetcare tool .
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"We do not maintain in Croydon:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Non-red route roads - these roads are maintained by \u003ca href=\"http://www.Croydon.gov.uk\"\u003eCroydon\u003c/a\u003e ","Litter removal on red routes - this is also the borough's responsibility","Network Rail track at London Overground stations - \u003ca href=\"https://www.networkrail.co.uk/communities/contact-us/\"\u003econtact Network Rail\u003c/a\u003e ","Taxis and mini cabs - these are owned by \u003ca href=\"/modes/taxis-and-minicabs/what-to-expect-from-your-journey\"\u003etaxi drivers and minicab offices \u003c/a\u003e ","Two bus garages in Croydon that are \u003ca href=\"/modes/buses/who-runs-your-bus\"\u003eowned and managed by bus companies\u003c/a\u003e ","Coaches"," \u003ca href=\"/info-for/taxis-and-private-hire/taxi-ranks\"\u003eTaxi ranks\u003c/a\u003e on borough roads. Cars and other vehicles parked on taxi ranks can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.croydon.gov.uk/doitonline/report-it\"\u003ereported to Croydon\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Report private hire vehicles (PHVs) parked on ranks or unattended taxis on ranks directly to us.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Dealing with severe weather"}
For documents relating to winter service in the boroughs, go to the Streets publications page .
